alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 18 at 3:51PM HST until January 19 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND MAUI AND FOR THE WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI LANAI AND BIG ISLAND UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... .A moderate size, medium period west northwest swell will steadily fall through Friday. This swell is producing High Surf Advisory (HSA) level surf heights across most Hawaiian Island north and west facing shores. ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR THE WEST FACING SHORES OF BIG ISLAND IS CANCELLED... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE WEST FACING SHORES UNTIL 6 AM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Surf heights 7 to 10 feet along west-facing shores. * WHERE...Kona and Kohala. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
